here’s some actual hangover help:

force yourself to throw up if you have nausea. it should make you tired and you’ll be able to sleep as well.

take some alka seltzer for the heartburn and stomach problems. it has aspirin in it as well and that should help too. for the nausea, buy yourself some nausea relief tablets or syrup. doordash it if you can, you don’t want to over exert yourself.

get yourself some pedialyte or liquid iv. you’re dehydrated, and that’ll make you feel bad. time to rehydrate.

take some ibuprofen. it’ll help with aches and pains. no tylenol though.

and finally, get some sleep. sleep is the best hangover cure. when you wake up you should be okay enough to eat something small and easy. search up sleeptube or a meditation to help you fall asleep easier. (i like michael sealy!)

For sure, the best way to recover as quickly as possible from drinking is a 2-Step process:

Step 1: An hour after you finish drinking, drink milk.  If you drank a little drink 1 cup or 8 ounces.  If you're completely wasted drink 2 cups.  Think of it this way:  Alcohol is like poison.  When you were little and ingested poison what were you told to immediately consume?  That's right milk.  The milk will coat your stomach and the alcohol (poison) will attack the milk instead of attacking your body.  The milk needs to be drunk all at once within 1 minute.

Step 2: 2 hours after drinking the milk you start the next step.  Over the next 10 hours you need to consume ALOT of water spread out over intervals.  Every 2 ½ - 3 hours you need to drink 10-12 ounces of water, 3 or 4 times in total.  This will help flush you out.  Now this next part is key.  A lot of people drink heavily at night and try to sleep it off.  When you are drinking the water you HAVE TO get up and walk around for 3 minutes.  I know you’ll be woozy and dizzy but you must get out of bed and at least stand and walk around a little immediately after drinking the water.  So drink a cup and a half of water, get up out of bed, stand up and walk around for a few minutes and then you can get back into bed.  Do that process 3-4 times.

Within 12 hours of starting the process (drinking the milk) and if done correctly, you should be at least 90%-100% clear of feeling drunk or hungover.

It's true that aspirin (and a lot of other painkillers) inhibit the production of prostaglandin BUT prostaglandin is responsible for protecting the lining of your stomach and intestines by regulating the amount of mucus produced. So taking aspirin along with liquor is a great way to damage your GI tract.

Around 80% of Asian people have a variant of the gene coding for the enzyme alcohol dehydrogenase called ADH1B, and almost all Chinese and Korean people have a variant of the gene called ADH1C.
